thread.title: Wheat Kings' power play roars to life against Pats
thread.title_full: Wheat Kings' power play roars to life against Pats

title: Wheat Kings' power play roars to life against Pats
text:
Wheat Kings' power play roars to life against Pats By: Perry Bergson Report Error 
Jayce Hawryluk scored four times and the visiting Brandon Wheat Kings snapped their power play goalless drought in a big way as they beat the Regina Pats 6-0 on Saturday at the Brandt Centre 
The Wheat Kings, who went 0-for-20 on the power play to start the Western Hockey League season, exploded for four goals with the man advantage on Saturday and one more that came two seconds after a power play ended. 
Wheat Kings head coach and general manager Kelly McCrimmon said he was encouraged by his team’s overall play. 
"We had real good traffic and got some rebounds and that was part of it," McCrimmon said. "Our power play was very good tonight. The first goal wasn’t a power-play goal but it came two seconds after a power play expired and that got us going. We were able to build on the lead and played well defensively." 
Hawryluk opened the scoring after an early Brandon power play had ended when he knocked in a rebound. Before the period ended, he had knocked in two more rebounds on the power play for the natural hat trick. 
John Quenneville wired a shot in early in the second on another power play and Hawryluk added his fourth goal of the game, again with the man advantage, just over a minute later. Reid Duke made it 6-0 late in the second with a nice shot from the slot that he created off the rush. 
Jordan Papirny, making his fourth straight start of the young season, stopped 16 shots for his seventh career shutout. He had five last season. 
Quenneville ended up with a goal and two assists, Nolan Patrick had three assists and Hawryluk added an assist for a five-point night. 
ICINGS:  Wheat King F Rihards Bukarts has been suspended by the WHL for a dangerous hit from behind on Friday against the Calgary Hitmen that earned him a major and game misconduct. The length of the suspension hasn’t been determined … Brandon’s scratches were Bukarts, F Tim McGauley, F/D Quintin Lisoway, F Garrett Armour and D Dominic Thom as Brandon dressed just two overagers … Quenneville, Patrick and Tyler Coulter skated on a line together on Saturday … Former Wheat King F Taylor Cooper was among the scratches for the Pats. He continues to recover from off-season shoulder surgery. 
» pbergson@brandonsun.com
